content.question: The distribution of weights of African bush elephants is skewed to the right with mean 6.42 tons and standard deviation 1.07 tons. Let the random variable <math alttext="W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the weight, in tons, of a randomly selected elephant. The weight is converted to kilograms using the formula <math alttext="Y equals 900 W" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>900</mn><mi>W</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of the following best describes the distribution of <math alttext="Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: Roughly symmetric with mean 5,778 kilograms and standard deviation 1.07 kilograms
Roughly symmetric with mean 5,778 kilograms and standard deviation 963 kilograms
Skewed to the right with mean 906.42 kilograms and standard deviation 1.07 kilograms
Skewed to the right with mean 5,778 kilograms and standard deviation 1.07 kilograms
Skewed to the right with mean 5,778 kilograms and standard deviation 963 kilograms

content.answer: Skewed to the right with mean 5,778 kilograms and standard deviation 963 kilograms

unit.text: 4: Probability, Random Variables, and Probability Distributions
